quotes.quote: Drugs and alcohol are the cruel engine of many an artists' creativity.
I love drugs, but I hate hangovers, and the hatred of the hangover wins by a landslide every time.
The drug culture has shaped at least one major change since the Sixties; It became the basis for overloading our prisons.
I never took hallucinogenic drugs because I never wanted my consciousness expanded one unnecessary iota.
Everything is a drug. Family, art, causes, new shoes... We're all just tweaking our chem to avoid the void.
Drugs are a waste of time. They destroy your memory and your self-respect and everything that goes along with your self esteem.
I don't do drugs. I am drugs.
Don't waste good drugs on killing yourself. Share them with friends and have a party. Or send them to me.
Drugs are not always necessary. Belief in recovery always is.
I was more addicted to self destruction then to the drugs themselves ... something very romantic about it
Drug misuse is not a disease, it is a decision, like the decision to step out in front of a moving car. You would call that not a disease but an error of judgment.
Reality is a crutch for people who can't cope with drugs.
I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me.
I learned why they're called wonder drugs -- you wonder what they'll do to you.
You can turn back on a person, but you can never turn your back on a drug, especially when it's waving a razor sharp hunting knife in your eye.
It's not a war on drugs, it's a war on personal freedom.
There is only one reason why men become addicted to drugs—they are weak men. Only strong men are cured, and they cure themselves.
The person who takes medicine must recover twice, once from the disease and once from the medicine.
Drugs are a bet with the mind.
Drugs are reality's legal loopholes.
Marijuana is self-punishing. It makes you acutely sensitive, and in this world, what worse punishment could there be?
Addiction begins with the hope that something 'out there' can instantly fill up the emptiness inside.
I don't need drugs to make my life tragic.

The experiences which drugs induce are as far removed from Reality as is a mirage, from water. No matter how much you pursue the mirage, you will never quench your thirst, and the search for Truth through drugs must end in disillusionment.
Experimenting with drugs is like target practice where your head is the bull.
You should just say no to drugs. That will drive the prices down.
Don't do drugs because if you do drugs you'll go to prison, and drugs are really expensive in prison.
Drugs have taught an entire generation of American kids the metric system.
I don't use drugs, my dreams are frightening enough.
If every drug in the world were abolished a physician would still be a useful member of society.
But I will say that the drugs are much more ferocious then they used to be. There are people wrecking their lives with addiction, which seems much more severe.
A miracle drug is any drug that will do what the label says it will do.
We broke up mostly because we didn't have a manager and everyone was on different drugs. I don't take them so it was a bit weird for me.
All drugs of any interest to any moderately intelligent person in America are now illegal.
Penalties against possession of a drug should not be more damaging to an individual than the use of the drug itself; and where they are, they should be changed.
Drugs are merely the most obvious form of addiction in our society. Drug addiction is one of the things that undermines traditional values.
A drug is a substance which, if injected into a rabbit, produces a paper.
I'm not an addictive personality, I just like getting high, that's all.
I used to have a drug problem, now I make enough money.
I've never had a problem with drugs. I've had problems with the police.
I don't like people who take drugs... customs men for example.
This whole drug thing: It's not a black thing. It's not a white thing. It's a death thing.
In a world like this one, people are going to naturally want to get high.
Most people don't know how they're going to feel from one minute to the next. But a dope friend has a pretty good idea. All you gotta do is look at the labels on the little bottles.
Finally, heroin seems to have become a loser drug, with its attractiveness fading for young people.

If even a small fraction of the money we now spend on trying to enforce drug prohibition were devoted to treatment and drug rehabilitation, in an atmosphere of compassion, not punishment, the reduction in drug usage and in the harm done to users could be dramatic.
The drug is really quite a remarkably safe one for humans, although it is really quite a dangerous one for mice and they should not use it.
Every form of addiction is bad, no matter whether the narcotic be alcohol or morphine or idealism.
Don't do drugs because if you do drugs, you'll go to prison, and drugs are really expensive in prison.
I don't use drugs; my dreams are frightening enough.
If we can get them to understand that saying no to drugs is rebelling against their parents and the generations of the past, we'd make it an enormous success.

Volumes could be written on the problem of drug addiction. Millions of barbiturates are swallowed every night to help the nation sleep. Millions of tranquilizers keep us calm during the day. Millions of pep pills wake us up every morning. The Bible warns that these flights from reality bring no lasting satisfaction.

A drug is neither moral or immoral—it's a chemical compound. The compound itself is not a menace to society until a human being treats it as if consumption bestowed a temporary license to act like an a**hole.
One of the characteristics of some drugs is that they make a person feel strong and alert—when in fact the opposite is the case. Don't allow yourself to be deceived.
Many people are trying to steady themselves by taking tranquilizers. Jesus is the greatest tranquilizer of all. He can straighten out your life and put you back on center.
Some young people are taking pills called 'heaven or hell' drugs, because you're liable to experience either one.
Cocaine habit-forming? Of course not. I ought to know. I've been using it for years.
You find out so many interesting things when you're not on drugs.
Drugs don't cause today's alarming crime rates, but drug prohibition does.

There is no life in doing drugs; I learned the reason that day / When they took my home, took my kids, took my freedom away / Prison has helped change my life to get my head on straight / I still have an outlook on life when I thought it was too late.
It's only in drugs or death we'll see anything new, and death is just too controlling.
There’s not a drug on Earth that can make life meaningful.
Drugs take you to hell, disguised as heaven.
Drugs are the enemies of ambition and hope, and when we fight against drugs we are fighting for the future.
Sometimes becoming drug-free has less to do with addiction and more to do with sanity.
I'm very serious about no alcohol, no drugs. Life is too beautiful.
People try drugs out of curiosity, to have a good time, to improve athletic performance, or to escape from stress, anxiety, or depression, but all drug addicts are willful victims themselves.
The drug-induced paradise of ecstasy and hallucination has enslaved the humankind since time immemorial, and more and more people are falling victim to the psychedelic pills.
Drugs suck more than anything else I have ever liked so much.
Here is the solution to the American drug problem suggested a couple years back by the wife of our President: 'Just say no.'
One of ecstasy's main ingredients is finding happiness in the tedious.
